Identification.LongTitle: Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to subsection 55(1) of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Acta, hereby makes the annexed Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations (1091).

Subsection.Text: The definitions in this subsection apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act.
adult means an individual of 18 years of age or older.
advertisement, in respect of a targeted substance, includes any representation by any means for the purpose of promoting, directly or indirectly, the sale or other disposal of the targeted substance.
common-law partner in relation to an individual, means a person who is cohabiting with the individual in a conjugal relationship, having so cohabited for a period of at least one year.
Department means the Department of Health.

MarginalNote.DefinedTermFr: infraction désignée en matière de drogue

Definition.Text: designated drug offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence against section 39, 44.2, 44.3, 48, 50.2 or 50.3 of the Food and Drugs Act, as those provisions read immediately before May 14, 1997;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence against section 4, 5, 6, 19.1 or 19.2 of the Narcotic Control Act, as those provisions read immediately before May 14, 1997;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an offence under Part I of the Act, except subsection 4(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in paragraphs (a) to (c).

Definition.Text: emergency medical service vehicle means any conveyance authorized under the laws of a province to transport individuals to hospitals and on which emergency medical services are provided.
export permit means a permit issued under section 43.
hospital means a facility that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is licensed, approved or designated as a hospital by a province under the laws of the province to provide health care or treatment to persons or animals; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is owned or operated by the government of Canada or of a province and that provides health services.

Definition.Text: import permit means a permit issued under section 37.

international obligation means an obligation relative to a targeted substance set out in a convention, treaty or other multilateral or bilateral instrument that Canada has ratified or to which Canada adheres.
licensed dealer means the holder of a dealer’s licence issued under these Regulations.
midwife has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations.
nurse practitioner has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations.
package includes anything in which a targeted substance is wholly or partly contained, placed or packed.
pharmacist means an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is registered or otherwise authorized under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is practising pharmacy in that province.

Definition.Text: podiatrist has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations.

prescription means, in respect of a targeted substance, an authorization from a practitioner stating that a specific amount of the targeted substance may be sold or provided for the individual or animal under the practitioner’s care named in the authorization.

qualified person in charge means the individual with the qualifications set out in subsection 19(2) who is responsible for supervising the activities carried out by a licensed dealer under a dealer’s licence at the premises specified in the licence.

Security Directive means the Directive on Physical Security Requirements for Controlled Substances (Security Requirements for Licensed Dealers for the Storage of Controlled Substances) published by the Department, as amended from time to time.
specified name means, in respect of a controlled substance included in Schedule 1,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name specified in column 1 of an item of Schedule 2, but, if only the chemical name is specified, means the chemical name specified in column 2 of that item; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled substance is not specified in Schedule 2, its chemical name and, if available, its common name.

Definition.Text: targeted substance means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a controlled substance included in Schedule 1, or a product or compound that contains the controlled substance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist, a controlled substance included in Schedule 1, or a product or compound that contains the controlled substance, that the midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist may prescribe, possess or conduct an activity with, in accordance with section 3 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations.

Definition.Text: test kit means a kit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a targeted substance, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a reagent system or buffering agent, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is designed to be used during the course of a chemical or analytical procedure to test for the presence or quantity of a targeted substance for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of which are not intended or likely to be consumed by, or administered to, a human or an animal.

Definition.Text: transhipment means, in respect of a targeted substance that has been unloaded or in any way removed from the means of transportation by which it came into Canada, its loading or placing on board or within or on the same or any other means of transportation used for its departure from Canada.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of these Regulations, a targeted substance is destroyed when it is altered or denatured to such an extent that its consumption is rendered impossible or improbable.

Subject to subsections (2) and 33(1), no person shall destroy a targeted substance other than a targeted substance that has been lawfully sold or provided to an individual for their own use or for the benefit of another individual or an animal under their care.
A pharmacist, a practitioner or the individual in charge of a hospital may destroy a targeted substance if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before the destruction, the pharmacist, practitioner or individual records information with respect to the destruction, including the name, strength per unit and quantity of the targeted substance to be destroyed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance is destroyed using a method of destruction that conforms with all applicable federal, provincial and municipal environmental legislation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person records the date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), the destruction is witnessed by a pharmacist or a practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: immediately following the destruction, the person who destroyed the targeted substance and the witness referred to in paragraph (d) sign and print their names on a joint statement, indicating that they witnessed the destruction and that the targeted substance destroyed has been altered or denatured to such an extent that its consumption has been rendered impossible or improbable.

Subsection.Text: A targeted substance that constitutes the remainder of an open ampule, the partial contents of which have been administered to a patient, may be destroyed by a hospital employee who is a licensed health professional without a witness.

Section.Text: A person must not

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: advertise a targeted substance to the general public; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: issue or publish an advertisement for a targeted substance unless the advertisement

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is published in literature distributed to, or in a trade publication for, licensed dealers, pharmacists, practitioners or hospitals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: displays in the upper left quarter of its first page, in a clear manner and in a conspicuous colour and size, the following symbol:

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Symbol for caution, consisting of a square outline divided in half from top left corner to bottom right corner. The top right half has an uppercase letter C inside and lower left half has an uppercase letter T inside.

Subsection.Text: A person listed in subsection (2) may possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 if the person has obtained the targeted substance

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the course of activities performed in connection with the enforcement or administration of any Act or regulations made thereunder; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: from a person who is exempt under section 56 of the Act from the application of subsection 5(1) of the Act with respect to that targeted substance.

Subsection.Text: The following persons may possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who requires the targeted substance for their business or profession and is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed dealer acting in accordance with their licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in the province in which the practitioner has such possession;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in a province other than the province in which the practitioner has such possession and such possession is for emergency medical purposes only;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital and such possession is for the purposes of and in connection with such employment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has obtained the targeted substance for their own use or for the benefit of another person or an animal under their care

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: from a practitioner in the course of treatment for a medical condition, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: from a pharmacist pursuant to a prescription issued or obtained in conformity with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has imported the targeted substance in accordance with section 68 for the person’s own use or for the benefit of another person or an animal under their care;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is employed as an inspector, an analyst, a peace officer, a member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police or a member of the technical or scientific staff of a department of the government of Canada or of a province and such possession is for the purposes of and in connection with such employment; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a person who, pursuant to a permit issued under Part 7, is responsible for the targeted substance while it is in transit or in transhipment in Canada.

Subsection.Text: A person may possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 if the person is an employee of or is acting as the agent or mandatary for a person referred to in any of paragraphs (2)(a) to (e) and (g), while acting in the course of their employment duties or role as agent or mandatary.
A person may possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is acting as the agent or mandatary of a person who he or she has reasonable grounds to believe is a person referred to in paragraph (2)(f); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the possession of the targeted substance is for the purpose of assisting the person referred to in paragraph (2)(f) in the administration or enforcement of any Act or regulations made thereunder.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 for the purpose of exporting that substance if the licensed dealer has obtained the substance under these Regulations and is licensed to export the targeted substance.
An individual may possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 for the purpose of exporting that substance in accordance with section 69.

Section.Text: Every person who is requested to fill an order or a prescription for a targeted substance must verify in a reasonable manner the identity of the person who gave the order or issued the prescription if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the signature on the order or prescription is not known to the person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the order or prescription is verbal and the person placing it is not known to the person.

Section.Text: Subject to section 59, a person licensed or otherwise authorized under these Regulations to deal in a targeted substance must store the targeted substance in the place used for the purpose of conducting their business or professional practice and in the area in that place where only authorized employees have access, except where the targeted substance is for the person’s own use or for the benefit of another person or animal under their care.

Section.MarginalNote: Security and reporting loss or theft

Subsection.Text: The following persons must take any steps that are necessary to ensure the security of a targeted substance in their possession and any licence or permit in their possession with respect to a targeted substance and must, not later than 10 days after discovery, report to the Minister any loss or theft of a targeted substance or of a licence or permit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person in charge of a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person to whom an exemption has been granted under section 56 of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a person who, pursuant to a permit issued under Part 7, is responsible for the targeted substance while it is in transit or in transhipment in Canada.

Subsection.Text: Every person who has issued or been issued an identifying code referred to in subsections 27(6) and (7) of the Narcotic Control Regulations must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take any steps that are necessary to ensure the security of the code; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: report to the Minister, not later than 10 days after discovery, any loss or theft of the code, a machine that is capable of producing a code or a document that discloses the code.

Section.Text: A person must not make any mark on or alter or deface in any manner any licence, permit or registration number issued under these Regulations.
The information or records required by these Regulations must be kept for a period of at least two years after

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of information, the day that the information was obtained; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a record, the day that the last transaction was recorded on the record.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister proposes to refuse to issue, amend or renew or proposes to revoke a licence, permit or registration number under these Regulations, the Minister must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: send a notice to the applicant or to the holder of the licence, permit or registration number together with a written report that sets out the reasons for the refusal or revocation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: give the applicant or holder an opportunity to be heard in respect of the refusal or revocation.

Subsection.Text: The suspension of a licence or permit under these Regulations takes effect as soon as the Minister informs the holder of the licence or permit of the decision to suspend and provides a written report that sets out the reasons for the suspension.

A person who receives a notice of suspension referred to in subsection (2) may, in the 10 days following the receipt of the notice, provide the Minister with reasons why the suspension of the licence or permit is unfounded.

Section.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application made under these Regulations, require the submission of any further information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to process the application.

In order to confirm any information contained in an application for a licence made under these Regulations or an amendment or a renewal of a licence, an inspector may, at a time during normal business hours that is convenient for the applicant and with the reasonable assistance of the applicant, inspect the premises for which the licence, amendment or renewal is requested.

Section.MarginalNote: Order to return a seized substance

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 24(1) of the Act, notice of application for an order to return a seized substance shall be given in writing to the Attorney General by registered mail.
The notice referred to in subsection (1) shall be mailed not less than 15 clear days prior to the date the application is to be made to a justice and must specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the justice to whom the application is to be made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the time and place where the application is to be heard;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance in respect of which the application is to be made; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence upon which the applicant intends to rely to establish that the applicant is entitled to possession of the targeted substance.

Section.Text: Where, pursuant to the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Police Enforcement) Regulations, a member of a police force or a person acting under the direction and control of the member is, in respect of the conduct of the member or person, exempt from the application of subsection 4(2) or section 5, 6 or 7 of the Act, the member or person is, in respect of that conduct, exempt from the application of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), sections 4 and 16 and subsection 33(1), a licensed dealer may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: produce, make, assemble, import, export, sell, provide, send, deliver, transport or destroy a targeted substance.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may carry out an activity set out in subsection (1) if the licensed dealer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is licensed to carry on the activity with respect to that targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carries out the activity in accordance with any conditions set out in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sells or provides the targeted substance to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: another licensed dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a hospital,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a person to whom an exemption relating to the substance has been granted under section 56 of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a producer of a targeted substance, produces the substance in the quantities and within the periods authorized by the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a maker or assembler of a product or compound that contains a targeted substance, but that is not a test kit, sells or provides the product or compound in the strength per unit and the quantity or package size authorized by the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the importation of a targeted substance, has an import permit issued under section 37; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the exportation of a targeted substance, has an export permit issued under section 43.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), a licensed dealer must not sell or provide a targeted substance to a person referred to in paragraph 15(2)(c) before the licensed dealer has received an order for the substance, either in writing in accordance with subsection (2) or verbally and recorded in accordance with subsection (3), from

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a hospital, a pharmacist practising in the hospital or a practitioner authorized to place orders for the substance on behalf of the hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licensed dealer, a person who is authorized to place an order for the substance on behalf of the licensed dealer; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the person to whom the substance is to be sold or provided in accordance with the Act and these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A written order for a targeted substance must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by a person described in any of paragraphs (1)(a) to (c); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an order transmitted electronically, be encoded in accordance with the requirements set out in subsections 27(6) and (7) of the Narcotic Control Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer who receives a verbal order must, before filling the order, record the following information with respect to the order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date and number of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person for whom the order is placed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the targeted substance ordered or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance ordered;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual placing the order; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual recording the order.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must not sell or provide a targeted substance to a pharmacist or practitioner named in a notice issued under section 79, unless the licensed dealer has received a retraction issued under section 80.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must not, in respect of an order for a targeted substance, deliver the order in more than one delivery unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the order for the substance states that the quantity of the substance that was ordered is to be supplied

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in separate deliveries, which in no case may total more than four, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: at specified intervals or on specified dates; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has insufficient stock of the substance at the time of receipt of the order, in which case the licensed dealer may supply the quantity of the substance that the licensed dealer has in stock and may deliver the balance afterwards in a single supplementary delivery.

Section.Text: To be eligible to be a licensed dealer, a person must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who ordinarily resides in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that has its head office in Canada or operates a branch office in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who occupies a position that includes responsibility for a targeted substance on behalf of a department of the government of Canada or of a province, a police force, a hospital or a university in Canada.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must employ, at the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies, no more than one qualified person in charge (who may be the licensed dealer) who supervises the activities with respect to the targeted substances set out in the dealer’s licence and who is responsible for ensuring compliance with these Regulations on behalf of the licensed dealer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may employ an alternate qualified person in charge at that premises who may perform the duties of the qualified person in charge when that person is absent.

Subsection.Text: The qualified person in charge and, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be familiar with the provisions of the Act and the regulations that apply to the dealer’s licence held by their employer and have a sufficient knowledge of chemistry and pharmacology and experience in those fields to properly carry out their duties;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be a pharmacist or a practitioner of medicine, dentistry or veterinary medicine, registered with a provincial professional licensing authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: possess a degree in an applicable science — such as pharmacy, medicine, dentistry, veterinary medicine, pharmacology, organic chemistry or chemical engineering — that is awarded by a Canadian university or, if awarded by a foreign university, that is recognized by a Canadian university or a Canadian professional association; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not have been convicted, as an adult, in the previous 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in Canada, a designated drug offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a country other than Canada, an offence that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated drug offence.

Subsection.Text: To apply for a dealer’s licence, a person must submit the following information to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the applicant,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name or, if the applicant is a corporation, their corporate name and any other name registered with a province, under which the applicant will carry out the activities set out in its dealer’s licence or will identify itself,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the address, telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile transmission number and e-mail address of the premises to which the dealer’s licence would apply, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if different from the address of the premises referred to in subparagraph (ii), the applicant’s mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth and gender of the individual in charge of the premises referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the qualified person in charge and, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge at the premises referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, date of birth and gender,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: their academic qualifications, training and work experience relevant to the duties of the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, of the alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: their hours of work,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: at the premises referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: their title at each work location,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and title of their immediate supervisor at each work location, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pharmacist or a practitioner, the name of the province in which the person’s current professional licence, certification or authorization was issued and the professional licence, certification or authorization number;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the names of the individuals authorized to place an order for a targeted substance on behalf of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the activities set out in subsection 15(1) for which the licence is sought that would be carried out at the premises to which the dealer’s licence would apply;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product or compound that contains a targeted substance, but that is not a test kit, that would be made or assembled for or by the applicant, a list that sets out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name of the targeted substance in each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the targeted substance in each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity or package sizes of each product or compound, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if the product or compound would be made or assembled by or for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, address and dealer’s licence number of that other licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is sought to produce a controlled substance included in Schedule 1,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name of the substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity, other than a product or compound that contains a controlled substance that is included in Schedule 1, that the applicant expects to produce under the dealer’s licence and the period during which that quantity would be produced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the substance would be produced for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, address and dealer’s licence number of that other licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the security measures, as determined in accordance with the Security Directive, at the applicant’s premises referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the method that the applicant proposes to use for recording their targeted substance transactions; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: for any activity set out in subsection 15(1), other than the activities described in paragraphs (f) and (g), the specified name of the targeted substance and the purpose for carrying out the activity.

Subsection.Text: An application for a dealer’s licence must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the individual in charge of the premises to which the licence would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement signed by the individual in charge indicating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of that individual’s knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual in charge has the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: An application for a dealer’s licence must be accompanied by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a signed declaration from the individual in charge of the premises, a signed declaration from the qualified person in charge and, if applicable, a signed declaration from the alternate qualified person in charge, stating that they have not been convicted, as an adult, in the previous 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in Canada, a designated drug offence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a country other than Canada, an offence that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated drug offence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a document issued by a Canadian police force with respect to each of the following individuals, stating whether the person has or has not been convicted, as an adult, in the previous 10 years, of a designated drug offence:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual in charge of the premises as set out in the application,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the qualified person in charge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the individual in charge of the premises, the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge has ordinarily resided in a country other than Canada in the previous 10 years, a document issued by a police force of that country stating whether the person has or has not been convicted, as an adult, in the previous 10 years, of an offence that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated drug offence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, signed and dated by the individual in charge of the premises, stating that the qualified person in charge and, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge have the knowledge and experience set out in paragraph 19(2)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge is not a pharmacist or a practitioner of medicine, dentistry or veterinary medicine authorized or entitled to practise by a provincial professional licensing authority, a copy of the person’s degree referred to in subparagraph 19(2)(b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where the applicant’s name appears on the label of a product or compound that contains a targeted substance, a copy of the inner label, as defined in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations, for each product or compound to which the licence would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is a corporation, a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certificate of incorporation or other constituting instrument, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any document filed with the province in which the premises to which the licence would apply is located that states its corporate name or any other name registered with the province, under which the applicant will carry out the activities set out in its dealer’s licence or will identify itself.

Subsection.Text: The method proposed by the applicant under paragraph (1)(i) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be capable of accounting for all targeted substances, including the strength of each targeted substance per unit in each product or compound and the number of doses in each container of a targeted substance, in the possession of the licensed dealer as required under section 35; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: permit the Minister to audit the activities of the licensed dealer with respect to targeted substances.

Section.Text: Subject to section 22, the Minister must, after examining the information and documents required under sections 11 and 20, issue a dealer’s licence that sets out the following particulars:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer or, if the licensed dealer is a corporation, its corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the activities that are permitted and, if the licence authorizes destruction, whether the licensed dealer may destroy targeted substances other than those that the licensed dealer produced, made, assembled, sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the premises at which the licensed dealer may carry on the permitted activities;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance for which the activities are permitted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the security level and the applicable inventory limitation required at the premises referred to in paragraph (d);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the date of issuance;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: comply with an international obligation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provide the level of security referred to in paragraph (f), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce the potential security, public health or safety hazard, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a producer of a targeted substance, the quantity of the targeted substance that may be produced under the licence and the period in which that quantity may be produced; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the maker or assembler of a product or compound that contains a targeted substance, but that is not a test kit, an annexed list that sets out the following information for each type of product or compound that may be made or assembled under the licence:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licence number,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name of the targeted substance in each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the targeted substance in each product or compound, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity or package sizes of each product or compound.

Section.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue, renew or amend a dealer’s licence in the following cases:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is not an eligible person described in section 18;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector, who has requested an inspection, has not been given the opportunity by the applicant to conduct an inspection under section 12;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: false or misleading information or false or falsified documents were submitted in or with the application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority of a country other than Canada or the United Nations raises a reasonable belief that the applicant has contravened an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have in place the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the licence is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is in contravention of or has contravened in the past 10 years

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act or any regulations made or continued under the Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of another dealer’s licence or an import or export permit issued to it under any regulations made or continued under the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance, renewal or amendment of the licence would likely create a risk to security, public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the individual in charge of the premises, the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge has been convicted, as an adult, in the previous 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in Canada, a designated drug offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a country other than Canada, an offence that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated drug offence;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed method of record keeping referred to in paragraph 20(1)(i) is not capable of accounting for the applicant’s targeted substance transactions as required under section 35 or permitting the Minister to audit the applicant’s activities with respect to targeted substances in a timely manner; or

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the information required under section 11 has not been provided or is insufficient to process the application.

Section.Text: A dealer’s licence expires on December 31 of the calendar year for which it is issued.

Subsection.Text: To apply to renew a dealer’s licence, the licensed dealer must submit to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in paragraphs 20(1)(a) to (j); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following documents:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the documents referred to in paragraphs 20(3)(a), (b) and (d),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable and if not previously submitted in respect of the dealer’s licence that is being renewed, the document referred to in paragraph 20(3)(e), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the original dealer’s licence that is to be renewed.

Subsection.Text: An application for renewal must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the individual in charge of the premises to which the renewed dealer’s licence would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement signed by the individual in charge indicating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual in charge has the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 22, the Minister must, after examining the information and documents required under subsections (1) and (2) and section 11, issue a renewed dealer’s licence that contains the information set out in paragraphs 21(a) to (k).
To have the content of its dealer’s licence amended, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a written application setting out the amendment sought and, if applicable, the documents that support the amendment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the original dealer’s licence that the licensed dealer seeks to have amended.

Subsection.Text: An application for amendment must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge of the premises to which the amended dealer’s licence would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: indicate that all information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must, after examining the application for amendment and the supporting documentation, amend the dealer’s licence in accordance with the application, unless there exists a circumstance described in section 22; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may add any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: comply with an international obligation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provide for the level of security referred to in paragraph 21(f) or the new level applicable as a result of the amendment being implemented, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce the potential security, public health or safety hazard, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: obtain the Minister’s approval before making any of the following changes:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a change relating to the security at the premises referred to in the dealer’s licence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the replacement or the addition of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an individual in charge of the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a qualified person in charge and, if applicable, an alternate qualified person in charge at the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a person authorized to place an order for a targeted substance on behalf of the licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, not later than 10 days after the event, when a person referred to in any of clause (a)(ii)(A) or (C) ceases to carry out their duties as set out in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application for a dealer’s licence under section 20,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the application to renew a dealer’s licence under section 24, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the request for approval under paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, not later than the next business day after the event, when a person referred to in clause (a)(ii)(B) ceases to carry out their duties as set out in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application for a dealer’s licence under section 20,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the application to renew a dealer’s licence under section 24, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the request for approval under paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, with the request for approval referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii), provide the Minister with the following information and documents with respect to the new person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the replacement of the individual in charge of the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 20(1)(b), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the documents specified in paragraphs 20(3)(a) to (c);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the replacement of the qualified person in charge or the replacement or addition of an alternate qualified person in charge at the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 20(1)(c), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the documents specified in paragraphs 20(3)(a) to (e); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the replacement or addition of an individual who is authorized to place an order for a targeted substance on behalf of the licensed dealer, the individual’s name.

Heading.TitleText: Revocation or Suspension of Dealer’s Licence

Section.Text: The Minister must revoke a dealer’s licence at the request of the licensed dealer or on being notified by the licensed dealer that the licence has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke a dealer’s licence in accordance with subsection 10(1) in the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents submitted in or with the application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has failed to comply with a provision of the Act or the regulations or a term or condition of the licence or of an import or export permit issued under these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is no longer an eligible person under section 18; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it has been discovered that the individual in charge of the premises to which the licence applies, the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge at those premises has been convicted, as an adult, in the previous 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in Canada, a designated drug offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a country other than Canada, an offence that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated drug offence.

Subsection.Text: Unless it is necessary to protect security, public health or safety, including preventing the targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use, the Minister must not revoke a dealer’s licence in the circumstances described in paragraph (1)(a) or (b) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has no history of non-compliance with the Act and the regulations made or continued under it; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations.

Section.Text: The Minister must suspend a dealer’s licence without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect security, public health or safety, including preventing the targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use.

A licensed dealer must include its name, as set out in its dealer’s licence, on all the means by which it identifies itself in relation to the targeted substance, including advertising, product labels, orders, shipping documents and invoices.

A licensed dealer must, when transporting an imported targeted substance between the port of entry and the premises set out in its licence, or when sending, delivering or transporting any targeted substance, including to a port of exit, take any steps that are necessary to ensure its safekeeping during transportation.

A licensed dealer must not complete a transaction involving a targeted substance unless the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge is physically present at the premises set out in the dealer’s licence.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may destroy a targeted substance that it produced, made, assembled, sold or provided or, where authorized by its dealer’s licence, any other targeted substance if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before destroying the substance, the licensed dealer obtains the Minister’s approval for the destruction in accordance with subsection 34(3); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is destroyed in the presence of at least two employees of the licensed dealer qualified to witness the destruction, one of whom must be the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge at the premises specified in the dealer’s licence.

Subsection.Text: An employee of the licensed dealer is qualified to witness the destruction if the employee

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge at the premises specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has sufficient knowledge of chemistry or pharmacology and experience in those fields to be able to confirm that the targeted substance listed in the application for the Minister’s approval has been destroyed, and whose duties for the licensed dealer do not include the receiving, preparing or shipping of targeted substances; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is a senior management officer of the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: If the targeted substance is to be destroyed at a location other than the premises specified in the dealer’s licence, the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge at the premises specified in the dealer’s licence must accompany the targeted substance to the location at which it is to be destroyed.
To apply for the Minister’s approval to destroy a targeted substance, a licensed dealer must submit the following information to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the location of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a brief outline of the method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the names and qualifications of the witnesses;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the targeted substances to be destroyed, including the specified name and, if applicable, the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the strength per unit, form and quantity of each targeted substance to be destroyed, including, if applicable, the number of units per package and the number of packages; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and licence number of the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: An application for the Minister’s approval for the destruction of a targeted substance must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge at the premises specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement indicating that the proposed method of destruction conforms with all applicable federal, provincial and municipal environmental legislation in the location where the targeted substance is to be destroyed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: indicate that all information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must approve the destruction of the targeted substance unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: false or misleading information or false or falsified documents have been submitted in or with the application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a proposed witness is not qualified under subsection 33(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance or a portion of it is required for the purposes of a criminal or administrative investigation, or any preliminary inquiry, trial or other proceeding under any Act or regulations thereunder;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: approval for the destruction would likely create a risk to security, public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance will not be destroyed within the meaning of subsection 1(2).

Heading.TitleText: Records, Books, Electronic Data and Other Documents

Section.Text: Every licensed dealer must keep, at the premises set out in the dealer’s licence, records, books, electronic data and other documents that contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each targeted substance transaction, the date of the transaction, the specified name and the quantity of the targeted substance received, produced, made, assembled, imported, purchased, exported, sold, provided, sent, delivered, transported or destroyed, as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the targeted substance is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: produced, made or assembled, the quantity produced, made or assembled and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the substance, the number of units per package and the number of packages,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: received or purchased, the name and address of the provider or seller,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: imported, the name and address of the exporter and the country of export and any country of transit or transhipment,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: sold, provided, sent, delivered or transported, the name and address of the purchaser or recipient,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: exported, the name and address of the importer, the country of final destination and any country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: destroyed, the name and address of the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge who supervised the destruction and the names and addresses of the other witnesses who attended at the destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement signed and dated by each witness stating that they have witnessed the destruction and that the targeted substances were destroyed in accordance with these Regulations and the Minister’s approval for the destruction.

Subsection.Text: To apply for a permit to import a targeted substance, a licensed dealer must submit the following information to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the targeted substance to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its specified name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, its brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the exporter in the country of export from whom the targeted substance is being obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the port of entry;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the customs office, sufferance warehouse or bonded warehouse to which the shipment is to be delivered; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each mode of transportation used, the country of export and, if applicable, any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: An application for an import permit must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge at the premises to which the targeted substance will be transported directly after clearing customs; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: indicate that all information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 38, the Minister must, after examining the information and documents required under sections 11 and 36, issue to the licensed dealer an import permit that sets out the following particulars:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in paragraphs 36(1)(a) to (f);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of issuance;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry, which shall be the earliest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 120 days after the permit is issued, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: December 31 of the year in which the permit is issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: comply with an international obligation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce the potential security, public health or safety hazard, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: An import permit is valid until the earliest of:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry of the dealer’s licence that pertains to the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation under section 27, 28 or 29 of the dealer’s licence that pertains to the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 41; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry, suspension or revocation of the export permit that applies to the targeted substance to be imported and that is issued by a competent authority in the country of export.

Section.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the application for the permit, there exists a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 22(c) to (f) or (h), with any modifications that the circumstances require;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not hold a dealer’s licence for the targeted substance that is to be imported or holds a dealer’s licence that will expire before the date of importation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has been notified in accordance with paragraph 10(1)(a) that one of the following applications submitted by the applicant with respect to the dealer’s licence under which the targeted substance would be imported is to be refused under section 22:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an application under section 20 for a dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an application under section 24 to renew a dealer’s licence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an application under section 25 for the amendment of a dealer’s licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the shipment for which the permit is requested would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the importation is for the purpose of re-exporting the targeted substance without having added any economic value to it in Canada.

Section.Text: The holder of an import permit for a targeted substance must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office, sufferance warehouse or bonded warehouse, as the case may be, at the port of entry at the time of importation.

The holder of an import permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of release, in accordance with the Customs Act, in Canada of a shipment that contains a targeted substance, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer and the numbers of the dealer’s licence and import permit with respect to the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of release of the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name or brand name of the targeted substance received; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance received.

Heading.TitleText: Revocation or Suspension of an Import Permit

Subsection.Text: The Minister must revoke an import permit at the request of the holder or if the holder informs the Minister that the permit has been lost or stolen.
Subject to subsection (3), the Minister must revoke an import permit in accordance with subsection 10(1) in the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there exists a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 28(1)(a) to (d) with respect to the dealer’s licence under which the targeted substance would be imported; or

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: the import permit was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents submitted in or with the application for the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the importation is for the purpose of re-exporting the targeted substance without having added any economic value to it in Canada.

Subsection.Text: Unless it is necessary to do so to protect security, public health or safety, including preventing the targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use, the Minister must not revoke an import permit in the circumstances described in paragraph (2)(a.1), 28(1)(a) or 28(1)(b) if the holder of the permit meets the conditions referred to in paragraphs 28(2)(a) and (b), with any modifications that the circumstances require.
The Minister must suspend an import permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit holder’s dealer’s licence that applies to the targeted substance being imported has expired or has been suspended or revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect security, public health or safety including preventing the targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the importation would contravene the laws of any country or transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: To apply for a permit to export a targeted substance, a licensed dealer must submit the following information to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, address and licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the targeted substance to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its specified name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, its brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the importer in the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the port of exit and, if applicable, any country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the customs office, sufferance warehouse or bonded warehouse at which the shipment is to be presented for export;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each mode of transportation used; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that, to the best of their knowledge, the shipment does not contravene any requirement of the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: An application for an export permit for a targeted substance must be accompanied by a copy of the import permit issued by a competent authority in the country of final destination that sets out the name and the address of the premises of the importer in the country of final destination.
An application for an export permit must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the qualified person in charge or the alternate qualified person in charge at the premises from which the targeted substance will be sent to the port of exit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: indicate that all information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 44, the Minister must, after examining the information and documents required under sections 11 and 42, issue an export permit to the licensed dealer that sets out the following particulars:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in paragraphs 42(1)(a) to (f);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of issuance;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry, which shall be the earliest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 180 days after the permit is issued,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: December 31 of the year in which the permit is issued, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the import permit issued by a competent authority in the country of final destination; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: comply with an international obligation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce the potential security, public health or safety hazard, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: An export permit is valid until the earliest of:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry of the dealer’s licence that pertains to the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation under section 27, 28 or 29 of the dealer’s licence that pertains to the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 47; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry, suspension or revocation of the import permit that applies to the targeted substance to be exported and that is issued by a competent authority in the country of final destination.

Section.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the application for the permit, there exists a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 22(c) to (e) or (h), with any modifications that the circumstances require;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not hold a dealer’s licence for the targeted substance to be exported or holds a dealer’s licence that will expire before the date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has been notified in accordance with paragraph 10(1)(a) that one of the following applications submitted by the applicant with respect to the dealer’s licence under which the targeted substance would be exported is to be refused under section 22:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an application made under section 20 for a dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an application made under section 24 to renew a dealer’s licence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an application made under section 25 for the amendment of a dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the shipment for which the permit is requested would contravene a requirement of the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the shipment would not be in conformity with the import permit issued by a competent authority of the country of final destination.

Section.Text: The holder of an export permit for a targeted substance must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office, sufferance warehouse or bonded warehouse, as the case may be, at the port of exit at the time of exportation.

The holder of an export permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of export of a shipment that contains a targeted substance, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer and the numbers of the dealer’s licence and export permit with respect to the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name or brand name of the exported targeted substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the exported targeted substance.

Heading.TitleText: Revocation or Suspension of an Export Permit

Subsection.Text: The Minister must revoke an export permit at the request of the holder or if the holder informs the Minister that the permit has been lost or stolen.
Subject to subsection (3), the Minister must revoke an export permit in accordance with subsection 10(1) in the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there exists a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 28(1)(a) to (d) with respect to the dealer’s licence under which the targeted substance would be exported; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the export permit was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents submitted in or with the application;

Subsection.Text: Unless it is necessary to do so to protect security, public health or safety, including preventing the targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use, the Minister must not revoke an export permit in the circumstances described in paragraph (2)(b), 28(1)(a) or 28(1)(b) if the holder of the permit meets the conditions referred to in paragraphs 28(2)(a) and (b) with any modifications that the circumstances require.
The Minister must suspend an export permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit holder’s dealer’s licence that applies to the targeted substance being exported has expired or has been suspended or revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect security, public health or safety including preventing the targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the exportation is not in conformity with an import permit issued by a competent authority of the country of final destination; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the exportation would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment.

Section.Text: This Part, other than section 57, does not apply to a pharmacist when practising in a hospital.
A pharmacist may, in accordance with this Part, compound a targeted substance pursuant to a prescription.

Section.MarginalNote: Record of receipt from licensed dealer
Section.Text: If a pharmacist receives a targeted substance from a licensed dealer, a pharmacist in another pharmacy or a hospital, the pharmacist must keep a record of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the targeted substance received or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and strength per unit of the targeted substance received, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensed dealer, pharmacist or hospital that supplied it; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it was received.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the activities authorized under section 55, a pharmacist may, subject to section 52, sell, provide, send, deliver or transport a targeted substance to or for an individual or for the benefit of an animal if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist sells or provides the substance in a container labelled in accordance with subsection (2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transaction is made pursuant to a prescription

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: dated and signed by a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided verbally to the pharmacist by a practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: transferred to the pharmacist under subsection 54(1) in accordance with subsection 54(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist has not transferred the prescription to another pharmacist; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: when the prescription has been provided verbally, the transaction is recorded by the pharmacist in accordance with subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who sells or provides a targeted substance to an individual must do so in a container that is labelled with the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the pharmacy or pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of issuance of the prescription and the number given to it by the pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual or animal for whose benefit the targeted substance is sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name or brand name of the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use specified by the practitioner.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who receives a verbal prescription for a targeted substance must, before filling it,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: record the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the individual or animal for whose benefit the prescription is provided,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date that the verbal prescription was provided,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name or brand name of the targeted substance, as specified in the prescription,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the recording pharmacist and the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the directions for use specified by the practitioner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the prescription is to be refilled, the number of times it may be refilled and, if specified, the interval between refills; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: keep a hard copy or create a written record of the prescription.

Section.Text: A pharmacist may only refill a prescription for a targeted substance if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner who prescribed it expressly directs that the prescription may be refilled and specifies the number of refills;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist makes a record of each refill in accordance with section 53;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: less than one year has elapsed since the day on which the prescription was issued by the practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: at least one refill remains on the prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where an interval between refills has been specified by the practitioner, it has expired.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who fills or refills a prescription for a targeted substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date the prescription was filled or refilled;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the targeted substance provided at the original filling and at each refill;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist’s name or initials; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may transfer a prescription for a targeted substance to another pharmacist, except a prescription that has already been transferred.
Before a pharmacist sells or provides a targeted substance to an individual under a prescription transferred under subsection (1), the pharmacist must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a verbal transfer, record the information required by subsection 51(3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
