Paragraph.Text: in the case of a written transfer, have obtained from the transferring pharmacist a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the prescription written by the practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the record made in accordance with subsection 51(3) of the practitioner’s verbal prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in all cases, record

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the transferring pharmacist,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of authorized refills remaining and, if applicable, the specified interval between refills, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the last refill.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who transfers a prescription under subsection (1) must record the date of the transfer, the name of the pharmacist to whom the prescription was transferred, the name and address of the pharmacy where that pharmacist practises and, if applicable, the number of refills that are being transferred.

A pharmacist may sell, provide, send, deliver or transport a targeted substance without a prescription to any of the following persons on receipt of an order from that person that specifies the name and quantity of the targeted substance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the order is written, a licensed dealer who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold or provided the targeted substance, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is licensed to destroy targeted substances, other than those that the licensed dealer produced, made, assembled, sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: another pharmacist, if the other pharmacist states that the targeted substance is required because of a delay or shortfall in an order for the targeted substance placed with a licensed dealer, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a hospital, if the order is placed by a pharmacist practising in the hospital or by a practitioner who is authorized to order the targeted substance on behalf of the hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister, if the order is a written order signed on the Minister’s behalf; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person to whom an exemption with respect to the targeted substance has been granted under section 56 of the Act, if the order is a written order and is accompanied by a copy of the exemption.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances set out in subparagraphs (1)(b)(i) to (iii), if the order is verbal, the pharmacist must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the pharmacist or practitioner placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the order was placed on behalf of an establishment, the name and address of the establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name or the brand name of the targeted substance ordered, as specified in the order;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the recording pharmacist.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who sells, provides, sends, delivers or transports a targeted substance without a prescription must keep a record of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the targeted substance or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and strength per unit of the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person referred to in subsection (1) to whom the targeted substance was sold, provided, sent, delivered or transported; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the transaction.

Subsection.Text: The pharmacist must keep the written order or, if the order is verbal, must create a hard copy of the order.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who closes premises in which a targeted substance has been stored must, not later than 10 days after the closure, inform the Minister of the date of closure, the location to which the targeted substance was moved and the quantity of the targeted substance that was moved.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who does not wish to receive or have possession of targeted substances may make a written request to the Minister to send to licensed dealers and pharmacies a notice, issued under section 79, that states that targeted substances must not be supplied to that pharmacist.
A pharmacist must not, unless their pharmacy has received a retraction issued under section 80,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a targeted substance to a pharmacist or practitioner named in a notice issued under section 79; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fill a prescription or order for a targeted substance from a practitioner named in a notice issued under section 79.

Section.Text: A practitioner may, with respect to a targeted substance, prescribe it for or administer it to an individual or animal, or sell, provide, send, deliver or transport it to or for an individual or for the benefit of an animal, only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the individual or animal is a patient that the practitioner is treating in their professional capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance is required to treat the individual’s or animal’s medical condition.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine may store an emergency supply of targeted substances at a remote location where emergency medical treatment is not readily available or in an emergency medical service vehicle, if the practitioner has an agent or mandatary at that location or in the vehicle who will control and administer the targeted substances on behalf of, and under the direction of, the practitioner.
When aid is being provided to an individual in an emergency, the agent or mandatary of the practitioner of medicine may administer a targeted substance from the emergency supply to the individual if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner of medicine has, by telephone or other means, directed the agent or mandatary to administer the targeted substance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the agent or mandatary follows written directives provided by the practitioner with respect to the administration of the targeted substance.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner must keep the following records:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name, the quantity and strength per unit of any targeted substance received from a licensed dealer, pharmacist or hospital and the date on which it is received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensed dealer, pharmacist or hospital that sold or provided the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a transaction involves a quantity of targeted substance that exceeds five times the usual daily dose for the substance, the name and quantity of the substance prescribed, administered, sold, provided, sent, delivered or transported, the name and address of the recipient and the date of the transaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an emergency supply referred to in subsection 59(1), the name of the administering agent or mandatary, the location of the emergency supply, the name, quantity and strength per unit of each targeted substance, the date of all transactions related to that emergency supply and the name of any individual to whom the targeted substance was administered.

Subsection.Text: In respect of the administration of a targeted substance from an emergency supply referred to in subsection 59(1), the agent or mandatary of the practitioner must keep the following records:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, strength per unit and quantity of each targeted substance administered and the date on which it was administered;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual to whom the targeted substance was administered; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the agent or mandatary of the practitioner who administered the targeted substance.

Subsection.Text: An agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine referred to in subsection 59(1) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect any targeted substance in their possession from loss and theft; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: inform the practitioner without delay of any loss or theft of a targeted substance.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine who is informed by their agent or mandatary of loss or theft of a targeted substance must inform the Minister in accordance with section 7.

Section.Text: A practitioner who does not wish to receive or have possession of targeted substances may make a written request to the Minister to send to licensed dealers and pharmacies a notice issued under section 79 that states that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: recipients of the notice must not sell or provide any targeted substance to that practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order for any targeted substance provided by that practitioner.

Subsection.Text: A hospital may, in accordance with this Part, sell, provide, administer, send, deliver or transport a targeted substance.

No person may order a targeted substance on behalf of a hospital other than a pharmacist or practitioner practising in the hospital who is authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to order targeted substances for the hospital.

Section.MarginalNote: Provision or administration to a patient
Section.Text: The person in charge of a hospital must not permit a targeted substance to be sold, provided or administered to a patient or animal under treatment as an in-patient or an out-patient of the hospital except pursuant to a prescription or other authorization of a practitioner practising in the hospital.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist practising in a hospital or an individual who is authorized by the person in charge of a hospital to fill orders for targeted substances on behalf of the hospital may, on receipt of an order specifying the name, quantity and, if applicable, strength per unit of a targeted substance from any of the following persons, sell or provide the targeted substance to that person without a prescription:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed dealer who

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: sold or provided the substance, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: is licensed to destroy targeted substances other than those that the licensed dealer produced, made, assembled, sold or provided,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner, if the practitioner states that the substance is required because of a delay or shortfall in an order for the substance placed with a licensed dealer or pharmacist,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, if the pharmacist states that the substance is required because of a delay or shortfall in an order for the substance placed with a licensed dealer, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: another hospital, if the order is placed by a pharmacist practising in the other hospital or a practitioner who is authorized to order the targeted substance on behalf of the other hospital and the order states that the substance is required because of a delay or shortfall in an order placed with a licensed dealer or a pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister, if the order is a written order signed on the Minister’s behalf; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person to whom an exemption with respect to the targeted substance has been granted under section 56 of the Act, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is an employee of or associated with the hospital, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the order is a written order accompanied by a copy of the exemption.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances set out in paragraph (1)(a), if the order is verbal, the pharmacist practising in the hospital or the individual who is authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to fill orders for the targeted substance on behalf of the hospital must, before filling the order, record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the order was received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the targeted substance or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the targeted substance ordered; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: their name.

Section.Text: The person in charge of a hospital must record, or cause to be recorded, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name, the quantity of any targeted substance received by the hospital and the date on which it was received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensed dealer, pharmacist or other hospital that sold or provided the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the targeted substance sold, provided, administered, sent, delivered or transported, the name and address of the recipient and the date of the transaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of any out-patient to whom a targeted substance is sold or provided under section 64.

Section.Text: If a targeted substance is stored in a hospital or the pharmacy department of a hospital and the hospital or department closes, the person in charge of the hospital must, not later than 10 days after the day of the closure, inform the Minister of the date of closure, the location to which the targeted substance was moved and the quantity of the targeted substance that was moved.

Subsection.Text: An individual who is a resident of Canada may, at the time of the individual’s return to Canada from a foreign country, import a targeted substance that is in their possession at the time of entry if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the substance has been obtained under a prescription and is labelled with the information set out in paragraphs 51(2)(a) to (g);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is importing the substance

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for their own use,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use of a person for whom the individual is responsible and who is travelling with them, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use of an animal for which the individual is responsible and which is travelling with them;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is imported to meet the medical needs of the individual or animal for whose benefit it is prescribed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is declared to a customs office at the port of entry into Canada at the time of import; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity being imported does not exceed the lesser of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a single course of treatment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a 90-day supply, based on the usual daily dose.

Subsection.Text: An individual who is a resident of a foreign country may, at the time that the individual enters Canada, import a targeted substance that is in their possession at the time of entry if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements set out in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity imported is the least of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the content of the container,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a 90-day supply, based on the usual daily dose, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the usual daily dose multiplied by the number of days that the individual will stay in Canada.

Section.Text: An individual may, at the time of their departure from Canada, export a targeted substance that is in their possession at the time of departure if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the substance has been obtained under a prescription and is labelled with the information set out in paragraphs 51(2)(a) to (g);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is exporting the substance

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for their own use,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use of a person for whom the individual is responsible and who is travelling with them, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use of an animal for which the individual is responsible and which is travelling with them;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is required to meet the medical needs of the individual or animal for whose benefit it is prescribed; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity exported does not exceed the lesser of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a single course of treatment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a 90-day supply, based on the usual daily dose.

Subsection.Text: A person may sell, provide, send, deliver, transport, import or export a test kit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registration number has been issued for the test kit under subsections 72(1) or 75(2) and the number has not been cancelled under section 74;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is labelled with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a test kit that is not subject to the labelling requirements of the Medical Devices Regulations,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the name and address of the maker or assembler or, in the case where the test kit is made or assembled pursuant to a custom order, the name and address of the person for whom the test kit was custom made or assembled, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is sold, provided, sent, delivered, transported, imported or exported for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose.

Subsection.Text: An individual who does not hold a dealer’s licence may possess a test kit that contains a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 if the test kit is labelled with its registration number.

The manufacturer or assembler of a test kit or, if the test kit is manufactured or assembled pursuant to a custom order, the person for whom the test kit was manufactured or assembled, may apply for a registration number for the test kit by submitting to the Minister an application containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: particulars of the design and construction of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the proposed use of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the targeted substance contained in the test kit, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name for the substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the substance is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the substance;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of each other substance contained in the test kit, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of each substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the substance is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of each substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use of the test kit.

Subsection.Text: An application for the registration of a test kit must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by an individual authorized by the applicant for that purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: indicate that all the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must, after examining the information and documents required under sections 11 and 71, issue a registration number for the test kit to the applicant if the applicant demonstrates that the test kit is designed to be used solely for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose.
The Minister must refuse to issue a registration number if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit poses a risk to security, public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance in the test kit being diverted to an illicit market or use, because

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the total amount of the targeted substance in the test kit is too high, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the adulterating or denaturing agent in the test kit is not likely to prevent or deter consumption of the targeted substance in the test kit by a human or animal or the administration of that substance to a human or animal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is likely to be used for a purpose other than those set out in subsection (1).

Section.Text: The requirement in subparagraph C.01.004(1)(b)(iv) of the Food and Drug Regulations that a symbol be displayed on the label of a targeted substance does not apply to a test kit if a registration number has been issued under subsection 72(1) or 75(2) for that test kit and the number is displayed on the label.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must cancel the registration number of a test kit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister receives a notice from the holder of the registration number stating that it has ceased all activities referred to in section 70 with respect to the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is a medical device and is no longer approved for sale in Canada under the Medical Devices Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: there exists a reason set out in paragraph 72(2)(a).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may cancel the registration number of a test kit if the Minister determines that the test kit is being used for a purpose other than a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose and, after considering the nature and extent of that other purpose, concludes that it poses a risk to security, public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance in the test kit being diverted to an illicit market or use.
When a registration number issued for a test kit is cancelled, the cancelled registration number

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must not be displayed on the label of any test kit made or assembled after the cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cancellation under paragraph (1)(a), must remain on the label of any existing test kit until all of the test kits with that registration number are disposed of.

Subsection.Text: If a registration number issued for a test kit has been cancelled under subsection 74(1) or (2), the maker or assembler of the test kit or, where the test kit is made or assembled pursuant to a custom order, the person for whom the test kit was custom made or assembled

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: may, after a period of 90 days following the cancellation, apply to the Minister for the issuance of a new registration number; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: must, in support of the application, provide the Minister with proof that the circumstance that gave rise to the cancellation has been corrected.

Subsection.Text: The Minister, after examining the application and supporting proof referred to in subsection (1), must issue a new registration number for the test kit unless there exists a circumstance set out in paragraph 74(1)(b) or (c) or subsection 74(2).

Section.Text: The holder of a registration number for a test kit issued under subsection 72(1) or 75(2) must inform the Minister in writing, within 30 days after the event, if they have

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ceased all activities referred to in section 70 with respect to the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: transferred the making or assembly of the test kit to another person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: increased the quantity of targeted substance in the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: changed the brand name of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: altered in any manner the adulterating or denaturing agent in the test kit or changed the quantity of either agent in it; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: substituted a new adulterating or denaturing agent.

Heading.Label: PART 7
Heading.TitleText: Targeted Substances in Transit or Transhipment

Subsection.Text: If a targeted substance is being shipped from a country of export to a foreign country by a route that requires it to be in transit through Canada or to be transhipped in Canada, the exporter in the country of export or an agent or mandatary in Canada of that exporter must apply to the Minister for a permit for transit or transhipment by providing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the exporter in the country of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the person who will be responsible for the targeted substance while it is in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the targeted substance for which the permit is requested,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its specified name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, its brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of transit or transhipment in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the Canadian port of entry and exit;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each mode of transportation that is to be used in Canada for the targeted substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transhipment, the address, if applicable, of every place in Canada at which the targeted substance will be stored during the transhipment and the expected duration of each storage.

Subsection.Text: An application referred to in subsection (1) must be accompanied by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the export permit issued by a competent authority in the country of export; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the import permit issued by a competent authority in the country of final destination.

Subsection.Text: An application referred to in subsection (1) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by a person who is authorized for that purpose by the exporter, including an agent or mandatary in Canada of that exporter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: state that all the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), after examining the information and documents required under sections 11 and 77, the Minister must issue a permit for transit or transhipment that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the exporter in the country of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the person who is responsible for the targeted substance while it is in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, quantity, purity and strength per unit of the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the countries of export and final destination and the numbers and expiry dates of the export and import permits issued by a competent authority in each of those countries;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of the transit or transhipment in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the names of the Canadian ports of entry and exit;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each mode of transportation that is to be used for the targeted substance while in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transhipment, the address, if applicable, of every place in Canada at which the targeted substance may be stored during the transhipment and the duration of each storage; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the dates of issuance and expiry of the permit.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue a permit for transit or transhipment if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance of the permit

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: would not be in conformity with an international obligation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: would be in contravention of the Act, the regulations, another Act of Parliament, or a law of the country of export, of the country of final destination or of a country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: would likely create a risk to security, public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the import permit issued by a competent authority in the country of final destination has expired or has been suspended or revoked.

Section.MarginalNote: Notice to cease providing targeted substances

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances set out in subsection (2), the Minister must issue a notice to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) advising them that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: licensed dealers and pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not sell or provide any targeted substance to the pharmacist or the practitioner named in the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order for any targeted substance provided by the practitioner named in the notice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: both paragraphs (a) and (b) apply with respect to the practitioner named in the notice.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued if the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a request to the Minister in accordance with subsection 57(1) or section 62, as the case may be, to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: been found, by the provincial professional licensing authority in the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner is practising, to have contravened a rule of conduct established by that authority and the authority has requested the Minister in writing to issue the notice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: been found guilty in a court of law of a designated drug offence or of an offence under these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all licensed dealers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies within the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice is authorized or entitled to practise and is practising;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice is authorized or entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any provincial professional licensing authority in another province that has made a request to the Minister to issue the notice; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any pharmacies in an adjacent province in which a prescription or order from the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice may be filled.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5), the Minister may issue the notice described in subsection (1) to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3), if the Minister, on reasonable grounds, believes that the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened a provision of the Act or the regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a targeted substance under a self-directed prescription or order or, in the absence of a prescription or order, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical, medical, dental or veterinary practice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, prescribed, administered or provided a targeted substance to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the pharmacist or practitioner, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical, medical, dental or veterinary practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for a quantity of targeted substance for which the pharmacist or practitioner was responsible under these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances described in subsection (4), the Minister must not issue the notice referred to in subsection (1) until the Minister has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consulted with the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner to whom the notice relates is authorized or entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: given that pharmacist or practitioner an opportunity to present reasons why the notice should not be issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: considered

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the pharmacist or practitioner in respect of the Act and the regulations made or continued under it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the pharmacist or practitioner pose a risk to security, public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: The Minister must provide the licensed dealers, pharmacies and provincial professional licensing authorities who were sent a notice under subsection 79(1) with a retraction of that notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstance described in paragraph 79(2)(a), the requirements set out in subparagraphs (b)(i) and (ii) have been met and one year has elapsed since the notice was sent by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstance described in any of paragraphs 79(2)(b) and (c) and (4)(a) to (d), the pharmacist or the practitioner named in the notice has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: requested in writing that a retraction of the notice be issued, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided a letter from the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner is authorized or entitled to practise in which the authority consents to the retraction of the notice.

Section.Text: The Minister may provide in writing any factual information about a pharmacist, a practitioner or a nurse that has been obtained under the Act or these Regulations to the provincial professional licensing authority responsible for the authorization or entitlement of the person to practise their profession

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the province in which the pharmacist, practitioner or nurse is authorized or entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority submits a written request that sets out the name and address of the pharmacist, practitioner or nurse, a description of the information being sought and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting a lawful investigation by the authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist, practitioner or nurse has

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: been found guilty in a court of law of a designated drug offence or of a contravention of these Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: in the case of a pharmacist or practitioner, done any act that the Minister, on reasonable grounds, believes contravenes a provision of these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the pharmacist, practitioner or nurse is not authorized or entitled to practise, if the authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request for information that states

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the name and address of the pharmacist, practitioner or nurse, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a description of the information being sought, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: documentation that shows that the pharmacist, practitioner or nurse has applied to that authority to practise in that province.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), these Regulations come into force on September 1, 2000.
Subparagraph 3(b)(ii), paragraphs 20(1)(h) and 21(f), subparagraph 21(i)(ii), paragraph 22(f), subparagraphs 25(3)(b)(ii) and 26(1)(a)(i) and section 73 come into force on September 1, 2001.
